definition: to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: A patrol car dashboard camera caught the incident on tape.
sentences.chinese: 一辆巡逻车的仪盘表摄像头拍到了这一过程。

sentences.english: Specialized vehicles such as snowmobile and patrol type ATVs are also in the works.
sentences.chinese: 一些特殊的款型比如雪地车以及巡逻车也将投入生产。

sentences.english: The precinct patrol car had been taken care of by Clemenza.
sentences.chinese: 附近的巡逻车都已经被克莱门沙给打点好了。

sentences.english: A state police cruiser was involved in a collision with a firetruck .
sentences.chinese: 一辆州警察巡逻车撞上了一辆救火车。

sentences.english: Stop, sit, and wait for the ski patrol.
sentences.chinese: 停下，座着，等雪场巡逻车。

sentences.english: When you call the violator back to your patrol car, ask him to bring the driver's license only please.
sentences.chinese: 在你叫违规者到你的巡逻车上时，让他只带上驾驶证。

sentences.english: The manager immediately called the police, who promptly dispatched four cruisers.
sentences.chinese: 经理立刻打电话报警，警察派了四辆巡逻车来。

definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
SWAT (Special Weapons And Tactics)/riot police/abbr. for 特種警察|特种警察[te4 zhong3 jing3 cha2]
